intro: Lamium moschatum var. ochroleucum, commonly known as white dead-nettle, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive white underside and produces small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and gardens. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it is often found in moist soils. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
